column2: description

Wonderlit is seeking a creative and talented teacher with a strong foundation in English and a flair for designing educational materials to join its journey to inspire, nurture and create a love for the English Language in children.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Research, source, plan and develop high quality curriculum for English curriculum in line with MOE syllabus and Wonderlit’s teaching pedagogies and requirements.
  • Plan and prepare weekly lesson plans which include teaching materials and audio-visual aids that aid effective teaching and facilitate active learning.
  • Coordinate review and feedback on the curriculum and update lessons on a continuous basis to meet teaching objectives.
  • Develop and conduct training programmes for teachers implementing the curriculum.
  • Conduct engaging and student-centred classes including reviewing and marking student’s writings/ scripts and providing timely feedback to parents.
  • Perform any ad-hoc duties or responsibilities assigned.
  • Be an ambassador for Wonderlit at all times in interacting with parents and other external stakeholders.

Required Qualifications & Experience

  • At least a Degree in English Language, English Literature, Law, Communications or related field.
  • At least 2 years of work experience in curriculum planning, development, training and teaching English and creative writing in an enrichment industry in Singapore.
  • Excellent academic track record in English Language, English Literature and General Paper (GP).
  • Strong work ethic, collaborative, creative, meticulous and an eye for detail.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, familiarity with other software (e.g. Photoshop, Illustrator) a plus.
  • Energetic, dedicated and enjoys working with and developing young children.
  • Willing to work 3 weekdays and both weekends (Saturdays and Sundays).

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $3,500.00 - $5,000.00 per month

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Employee assistance programme
  • Employee discount
  • Parental leave
  • Professional development

Schedule:

  • Weekend availability

Supplemental pay types:

  • Performance bonus

Work Location: In person

OVERALL PURPOSE - Delivering technical and programming leadership to the centre’s recreational gymnastics program and to ensure quality assurance and excellent delivery.

JOB DESCRIPTION

  • Support and contribute to the company’s mission statement - Empowering children through Active play
  • To ensure that a commercially successful recreational centre is run.
  • To ensure that monthly and annual participation and service delivery KPIS are met.
  • To ensure course registers are up to date and course payments are received.
  • To respond to class enquiries in a timely manner.
  • To support the development of the recreational Gymnastics program.
  • To instruct and motivate pupils following best practices in Gymnastics.
  • Motivate and assist gymnasts to develop new skills.
  • Know how to reduce the risk of injury to gymnasts.
  • To plan and prepare progressive lesson plans for all classes (in writing)
  • To ensure junior trainers are aware of their duties and have been provided with lesson plans within an appropriate time frame.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with the various stakeholders
  • To remain fully informed of the latest developments in gymnastics.
  • To ensure the Health / Safety / Cleanliness policy of the centre is adhered to all times.
  • Maintain high standards of personal presentation and ensure that the coaching team are all following the same procedures.
  • To attend any training which is required as well as plan out training schedule for junior staff on new program introduction
  • To work with the other trainers in the preparation, running and evaluation of each session.
  • Acting as a mentor in the development of other coaches.
  • To provide cover or suitable notice of cancellation of any sessions that cannot be attended.
  • To handle recruitment as needed.
  • Require someone educated to Degree Level in a Sports Coaching Qualification or with relevant Gymnastics qualification.
  • To work with the Directors on the planning and growth strategies of the company.
  • A FUN PERSONALITY IS A MUST!
  • Previous experience working with children.
  • We do require someone who is comfortable using computer software programs like Word, Excel as well as Google Docs.
  • Please apply clearly indicating current and expected salaries.
  • Kindly note that shortlisted candidates will go through reference checks process.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Weekend availability

About us

We are a small but highly effective team providing customized solutions for our customers. Our activities going fom small microcontroller based solution over PLC and robot programming to MES data collaborations. Being able to handle almost everything what can be programmed is our daily bread. Understanding our customer needs, combining it with top nodge technology while creating out of the box solutions whith profound knowledge of the industrial standards is our niche.

We provide industrial automation software solutions for our mainly semiconductor related customers. Solid electric and electronical background knowledge is mandatory. If locical thinking as well as problem solving is your game you are perfectly right with us. Hands on and physical fitness will make your life easier. Handling of different programming languages from Assembler to C# is good to know but we will guide you through. We provide a lot to learn if you like to catch it. Everyone with a master degree and the right drive to shape the future is welcome.

  • Health insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • On call

The CSG Engineering Rotation Program provides you a fast-paced, dynamic organization in a supportive environment that encourages learning and growth. The program consists of 3 rotations, each 12-months long, to offer you the ability to learn across different projects, solutions, and technical deliverables needed to bring our products to market. Built into the program are key opportunities for networking, knowledge sharing, and career progression


The Software Engineering team delivers next-generation software application enhancements and new products for a changing world. Working at the cutting edge, we design and develop software for platforms, peripherals, applications, and diagnostics — all with the most advanced technologies, tools, software engineering methodologies and the collaboration of internal and external partners.

Join us as a Software Engineer on our Client Solutions Group Engineering team in Singapore to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve
As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for the innovation, design, implementation and debugging of modules and infrastructure created for our next generation product offering. This is an exciting and dynamic program with great opportunities to deliver innovation across emerging trends (Cloud services, Security, Microservices). We are looking for a highly motivated individual to run self-directed projects and investigations to directly contribute to the innovation of this solution. We are looking for candidates who are comfortable taking accountability and are able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our rapidly evolving business.

You will:

  • Research and develop key deliverables to our next generation offering
  • Be part of the team responsible for delivering the feature set of our next generation cloud client computing innovation.
  • Work in a fast-paced environment tackling real world challenges and innovating across emerging trends
  • Develop clients and solutions for cloud services like AWS, Azure and GCP

Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering
  • Ability to build, repair and prepare assemblies across product lines
  • highly motivated individual to run selfdirected projects and investigations to directly contribute to the innovation of this solution
  • comfortable taking accountability and are able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our rapidly evolving business


Who we are

We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you.

Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.

Application closing date: 30 November 2023

Dell Technologies is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

Job ID:R234786


Dell’s Flexible & Hybrid Work Culture

At Dell Technologies, we believe our best work is done when flexibility is offered.

We know that freedom and flexibility are crucial to all our employees no matter where you are located and our flexible and hybrid work style allows team members to have the freedom to ideate, be innovative, and drive results their way. To learn more about our work culture, please visit our locations page.

Nice to Meet You! We are Ascenda
Ascenda provides the rewards infrastructure for leading financial services brands across the world.Our clients include the world’s largest banks, top tier card issuers and fintechs who utilise our rewards infrastructure to power their earn & burn rewards programs. These include American Express, CapitalOne, HSBC, Brex, Virgin Money, SMBC, ICBC, Bradesco, ANZ, HDFC and Top 10 financial services brands in many other countries.With a best-in-class technology suite and the world’s broadest rewards content marketplace, we are the engine behind winning premium rewards propositions for financial services all around the globe.Our clients are spread across continents, and we serve over 1 billion customers globally. No matter where you are in the world, you’ll recognize our footprint!We believe that nothing should stand in the way of companies who strive to drive growth via compelling and effortless rewards propositions that their customers love.


Welcome to the future of customer growth. Join us as we shape the future of rewards in financial services!


Engineering excellence is our edge

We take great pride in building world-class software products that derive their success from beautiful architecture, high performance, ease of use and solid security in-depth.

Our teams are passionate about great code and global scalability. The technical problems we are most excited to solve go far beyond our current areas of expertise, which motivates us to push the limits and expand our own horizon every day. Work with problems like

  • Billions of points transactions yearly
  • Millions of spend data along with a multitude of user segments daily
  • Maintaining & securing thousands of customer sessions across platforms every second


Join the best training ground for tomorrow’s superstar developers

When you join Ascenda as a fresh graduate, you’ll be delivering real products to customers in a matter of weeks! Benefit from our unique work environment designed all around rapid learning, close mentoring and ownership.


You will start by owning well-defined sub-components of the platform, and work quickly towards broader responsibility for entire services. Solve problems beyond just building features, gain exposure to domains like hi-throughput systems, de-fi backed services, loyalty in financial services and much more.


Join us if you like working like a product owner. If you’re curious, humble and always on the hunt for more learning opportunities. You’ll get a lot of independence and responsibility right away, and you'll learn at an amazing rate! No legacy protocols, no corporate bureaucracy, no multitude of approvals before shipping your updates.


Here are just a few examples of exciting engineering challenges awaiting our fresh graduate developers

  • Work with one of our product teams to improve the platform’s usability for consumers, including features such as merchant deals, travel booking, our currency exchange network, or payment acceptance.
  • Integrate with a variety of global suppliers, partners and client systems so that more customers can shop, travel, exchange rewards currencies and be rewarded for their activities with minimum fuss and maximum confidence.
  • Increase Ascenda's platforms scalability and speed so that our architecture stays ahead of user growth and transaction volumes.

You’ll also learn critical foundational skills in other important aspects of large-scale platform such as:

  • Security & Compliance - how to build secure software, especially for financial institutions.
  • Infrastructure - how to automatically deploy and scalable infrastructure.


Who we are looking for:

  • Love building things. Passionate and get energised about using cutting-edge technology to build the next generation of amazing digital products.
  • A team player, willing to help other developers, share knowledge and care deeply about the product you build.
  • Enjoy meritocracy. Be judged by what you deliver and not what you speak
  • Have some experience in at least one backend language (Ruby preferred, but not obligatory).
  • Have some experience in building frontends, either in vanilla JS or using frameworks.
  • Possess good communication skills, are not afraid of suggesting changes and improvements.
  • A fast learner, always curious to learn new languages and libraries.
  • Minimum Degree Holder (Fresh Graduates).

What matters at ASCENDA:

We are passionate, We keep things simple, We focus on results, We work together & We innovate!

We have a REWARDING WORKPLACE that provides a:

  • High growth environment & exponential career development
  • Mobile & flexible work environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Travel perks & Employee rewards


Ascenda is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.

We thank you for your understanding that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews.

Job Summary:

As a Software Test Engineer at BMM, you will be testing gambling products and play an important role in helping to protect the public and the industry.

We are looking for a professional like you with a high attention to detail, and good software and hardware skills.

Job Responsibilities

You will be working as a member of a close-knit, supportive team and report to a Team Leader or Group Manager. You will:

  • Follow BMM procedures to test and evaluate software products.
  • Perform functionality, usability and regression testing of products.
  • Perform review of source code.
  • Develop, perform and document test procedures to verify problem fixes.
  • Track, analyse, record & verify all software functionality discrepancies.
  • Carry out scheduled testing and provide feedback to the Team Lead.
  • Perform functionality and regression testing of products.
  • Report and escalate critical issues to your Team Lead.
  • Test configuration and compatibility of software on hardware platforms.
  • Monitor progress to meet milestones or deadlines.

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or electrical engineering.
  • Entry level position with 1 - 2 years’ experience.
  • Excellent communication skills in English.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in C++ programming.
  • Experience working in the gambling industry is advantageous.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience.
  • Extensive on-the-job training.
  • Company culture focussed on employee development & career progression.

Company Overview

BMM Testlabs is the longest established, independent gaming certification lab in the world. We have offices in Las Vegas, North America, Canada, Argentina, Peru, South Africa, Spain, Italy, Romania, Solvenia, Poland, Australia, Singapore, Macau and India.

BMM is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for this role.

Padlet is building software for a good education. A good education is one that inspires curiosity, creativity, and community. Our software enables that through visual content creation and collaboration in millions of classrooms worldwide.


Think of an exceptional product, say the Dyson vacuum cleaner or WD40. What makes it exceptional is that not only does it perform its function well, it makes you feel great using it. It almost makes you want to have more problems so you could use the product more.

We want Padlet to be an exceptional product. We are looking for Frontend Engineers to improve our web apps and delight a billion people.

Responsibilities

  • Building new features. E.g. creating beautiful slideshows in Padlet.
  • Creating delight. E.g. through animations and micro UI.
  • Making the web apps faster. E.g. reducing javascript payload.
  • Improving how we work. E.g. improving our component library or tools we use to translate the web app into 40+ languages.

Qualifications

  • At some point in your life, someone has told you: “you write good code.”
  • You know how to copy-paste code from Stack Overflow.
  • Bonus: you have a good sense of humor.

About Padlet

  • Vision: Every child in the world will grow up with Mickey Mouse and Padlet.
  • Product: We are making the default way of collecting and sharing thoughts on the Internet. People love the product.
  • Impact: We have over 50 million active users making Padlet one of the most used apps on the planet. Our goal is to be THE the most used app on the planet.
  • Money: We are venture backed AND profitable. We are built to last one hundred years.
  • Badassery: We are 36 people (plus a baby crane that we've adopted but it doesn't really do much). That's over a million active users per employee. Some badass people work here.

Tech stack

  • Web: VueJS, Tailwind.
  • Mobile apps: React Native (with Swift and Java where necessary.)
  • Backend: Ruby (Rails), Typescript, Elixir (Phoenix), and Python.
  • Storage: Postgres, Redis, Elasticsearch, Firestore, and Snowflake.

Joys of engineering at Padlet

  • We have very few meetings. We value keeping you in flow.
  • A lot of people use Padlet. We have to solve interesting real-time collaboration problems.
  • Our users are in over 200 countries, using all kinds of devices and connections, and speaking over 40 languages. We have to solve interesting internationalization problems.
  • We like to craft delightful user experiences. They’re satisfying to build.
  • We try to solve problems creatively instead of just throwing money at them. We are engineers! We thrive in constraints, not in the absence of them.
  • We ship often.
  • We value beautiful code.

Sorrows of engineering at Padlet

  • We grew pretty fast last year and our processes are still catching up. E.g. we don't have 100% code coverage yet. Our deployment process isn't as painless as it could be. This sometimes leads to spending time on things that aren't the most fun. We’re working on it!
  • Our project management process could be better. This sometimes leads to re-speccing in the middle of development, getting in the way of programming flow. We’re working on it!

Some people you'd work with

  • Linh Nguyen: At any given point, no one really knows where Linh is. We learn of his existence through pull requests and code reviews. Frontend maestro.
  • Brian Koh: Only human we know who has impulsive urges to exercise. When he does, he doesn't care about outfits. We've seen him running in boots, tight jeans, and leather jackets. Exceptional engineer and even better mentor.

Benefits

  • Top tier medical, insurance for you and your family.
  • Good stock options.
  • Catered lunches and dinners.
  • 20 vacation days. Plus sickness and bereavement days for when life happens.
  • All the gadgetry you need, including a new phone every year.

Special time to join

Because we're small, there's a lot of energy. And because we have tremendous traction, your first commit touches millions. This combination is rare and quite satisfying.

As a Junior Software Engineer (Java) for the Product Engineering team, you will support in the design, development and validation of tools to be implemented within the organization.

column2:
Ascenda is a global provider of innovative loyalty solutions and operates premium rewards propositions for major financial services and travel brands worldwide. As a trusted partner powering over 70 of the world’s leading rewards programs, Ascenda develops end-to-end solutions to address the most meaningful challenges facing the loyalty industry today. By deeply profiling local market needs to provide the right technology, content and value propositions alongside careful management of marketing, servicing, costs, and fraud, Ascenda delivers highly compelling and beautifully simple plug & play offerings that eliminate the trade-off between cost and customer value.


At its heart, Ascenda is an engineering and technology company. Our products and services help many financial services and travel brands serve millions of customers globally better. We take pride in building beautifully designed, performant, easy to use but yet secure products and place a huge emphasis on delivering great code.


We're looking to bring in passionate engineers who're keen to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment. You take great pride and your work and feel a great sense of accomplishment in building beautiful products that scale.


At Ascenda, we have a huge focus on coaching on mentorship. As an intern, you will be given the correct guidance, mentorship, as well as opportunities for you to grow your career. We value the insights and perspectives you may bring to the company as a new intern and look forward to the diversity you will add to the team.


Internship window: May - August (3 months minimum). If your university/ school is looking at 6 - 9 month long traineeships, we're open to it too. Please state so in your application to us.


In this internship, you will be:

  • Working in 1 of our many engineering teams in Ascenda, ranging from our core API platform and services, to frontend products and high throughput backend systems. As an internship, you will get the opportunity to develop your skills across multiple teams.
  • Delivering products to customers in a matter of weeks after you join! We believe in giving everyone ownership, including our interns. You will start by owning small pieces of the platform and working your way up.
    • Work within one of our platform teams who look at specific areas of Ascenda's platforms (e.g. travel booking, points transfers, our payments, customer engagement platform, or 1 of our core data, platform orchestration teams) to figure out how best to improve our product for our customers through new features and capabilities that will be used globally
    • As we grow our users and transaction volumes to reach new markets, our architecture needs to grow too. You’ll help us to make Ascenda's platforms faster, more convenient and scalable
  • Learning about other aspects of software engineering, such as,
    • Security & Compliance - how do we build secure software for financial institutions
    • Scalability - learn how to adapt your code in a way that scales


Ascenda offers:


  • Flexible working environment
  • Diverse and friendly working culture. Members of our team come from over 20 nationalities worldwide!


We are looking for someone who is:

  • Passionate and excited about using technology to build great products!
  • Have some experience in at least one backend language (Ruby preferred, but not obligatory)
  • Have some experience in building frontends, either in vanilla JS or using frameworks.
  • A team player, willing to help other developers, share knowledge and care about the product you build
  • Possess good communication skills, are not afraid of suggesting changes and improvements
  • A fast learner, able and willing to learn new languages and libraries


Candidates must be authorised to work in Singapore.

Job Description:

A Software Engineer designs, develops, and maintains software applications, systems, and solutions. They collaborate with cross-functional teams to create efficient and user-friendly software.

Job Scope and Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze software requirements.

Design software solutions, architecture, and user interfaces.

Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using programming languages.

Develop and implement software features, modules, and enhancements.

Perform software testing and debugging to identify and fix issues.

Collaborate with QA teams to ensure software quality and functionality.

Stay updated on software development trends and best practices.

Contribute to documentation and provide technical support to users.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Experience:

  • REST: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Java: 1 year (Preferred)

Padlet is building software for a good education. A good education is one that inspires curiosity, creativity, and community. Our software enables that through visual content creation and collaboration in millions of classrooms worldwide.

Benefits

  • Top tier medical insurance for you and your family.
  • Good stock options.
  • Catered lunches and dinners.
  • 20 vacation days. Plus sickness and bereavement days for when life happens.
  • All the gadgetry you need, including a new phone every year.

Special time to join

Because we're small, there's a lot of energy. And because we have tremendous traction, your first commit touches millions. This combination is rare and quite satisfying.

Nice to Meet You! We are Ascenda

Ascenda revolutionizes loyalty solutions for fintechs, financial institutions, and loyalty alliances globally. We pride ourselves on pushing boundaries, offering beautiful, functional, and fast-implementing designs that provide exceptional customer benefits.


About Ascenda Travel

Ascenda Travel was born in 2015 as Kaligo.com when we first started powering highly rewarding loyalty points earn for customers on their hotel stays; We now host 700,000+ hotels, 100,000+ flights powering the stays & redemptions for millions of customers across our plethora of B2B team-ups globally.


Our mission today is to deliver the best in class customer experience & varied selection of cars, hotels & flight bookings.


Engineering excellence is our edge

We take great pride in building world-class software products that derive their success from beautiful architecture, high performance, ease of use and solid security in-depth.


Our teams are passionate about great code and global scalability. The technical problems we are most excited to solve go far beyond our current areas of expertise, which motivates us to push the limits and expand our own horizon every day. Work with problems like:


  • Billions of points earn & burn yearly
  • Millions of spend data along with a multitude of user segments daily
  • Maintaining & securing thousands of customer sessions across platforms


The Role and Expectations

In the Software Engineer role for our Travel Team, you will have the opportunity to contribute significantly to building and enhancing our innovative SaaS-based travel platform. We value a proactive approach and eagerness for team collaboration. Your role will require a balance of both front-end and back-end skills.


  • Work closely with fellow like-minded engineers on our hotels, cars, flights booking platform used by millions of our customers worldwide
  • Engage closely with our designers, product owners, and other engineers in developing travel experiences like classified room images, payment construct and methods integrations for users in different parts of the world.
  • Adhere to and practice engineering best practices within the team - such as code reviews, API integration tests, writing our solutions in a maintainable manner.
  • Increase our platform’s speed and flexibility so that our architecture stays ahead of user scale and checkout volumes.


Who we are looking for:

  • 3 years of solid programming experience, including front-end and back-end development
  • Proficiency in at least one frontend language, preferably Typescript
  • Experience in building frontends, either using vanilla JS or specific frameworks (Angular, React)
  • A fast learner with curiosity to learn & explore new languages and libraries - plumbing the depths of our stack and frameworks used are key in enabling optimisations for scale
  • Strong communication: articulate complex ideas in a simple, relatable style
  • A team player with a collaborative approach and willingness to assist others


What matters at Ascenda:

We are passionate, We keep things simple, We focus on results, We work together & We innovate!


Benefits:

We have a REWARDING WORKPLACE that provides


  • High growth environment & exponential career development
  • Mobile & flexible work environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Travel perks & Employee rewards


Ascenda is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.

We thank you for your understanding that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews.

About the Role


Abnormal Security is looking for an enthusiastic and driven software engineer to join the Email Productivity (EPR) team. The EPR team is responsible for engineering and managing all facets of the Email Productivity product, a key product which drives a significant portion of Abnormal's revenue. As a pivotal member of the team, you will be involved in every critical aspect of the Email Productivity product, from managing its underlying infrastructure to creating intuitive customer-centric components. If you are eager to gain hands-on experience working with high-volume systems and want to make a notable impact, this opportunity is tailored for you. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a proactive and adaptable approach to learning.


What you will do


  • Work with other software engineers in the team to develop robust and scalable features
  • Assume ownership of the reliability of the features you develop, including comprehensive unit tests and rigorous integration testing
  • Participate in on-call rotations and provide technical support to effectively troubleshoot and resolve customer issues
  • Communicate effectively with the team in an async manner. Display a strong sense of initiative and ownership in providing updates, discussing challenges and proposing solutions without prompting
  • Demonstrate a high degree of enthusiasm and strong desire to learn, with the ability to quickly grasp new concepts

Must Haves


  • BS degree in Computer Science, Applied Sciences, Information Systems or other related engineering field
  • 1+ years of experience as a backend engineer, developing web applications.
  • At least one Software Engineering internship experience in the industry
  • Experience working individually as well as in groups on a regular basis, proficient in asynchronous and written communication
  • Experience participating in hackathons, innovation challenges or building out personal projects

Nice to Have


  • Experience with our stack: Python, Go, AWS, K8s, Django, Spark, Prometheus
  • Experience leading a small team to build a feature or component from scratch

The Engineering and Technology team is at the core of the Shopee platform development. The team is made up of a group of passionate engineers from all over the world, striving to build the best systems with the most suitable technologies. Our engineers do not merely solve problems at hand; We build foundations for a long-lasting future. We don't limit ourselves on what we can or can't do; we take matters into our own hands even if it means drilling down to the bottom layer of the computing platform. Shopee's hyper-growing business scale has transformed most "innocent" problems into huge technical challenges, and there is no better place to experience it first-hand if you love technologies as much as we do.

About the Team:
Our team operates with dual responsibilities. Firstly, we focus on building the front-end of Shopee’s infrastructure platforms, crafting user-friendly tools that enhance the productivity of thousands of developers. We play a pivotal role in developing internal systems that significantly impact the daily operations of all developers. Secondly, we are dedicated to constructing an end-to-end site-building solution that provides a seamless, cloud-native development experience. This solution is integral to our internal engineering portals and various business applications.
Job Description:
  • We are currently in search of experienced engineers (senior or expert level) to join our team.
  • As a key contributor, you will take ownership of various product features within our infrastructure.
  • Your role involves providing constructive feedback on product requirements and ensuring timely completion of tasks.
  • Your efforts will not only enhance user experiences but also contribute to our team's technical excellence.
  • You will be expected to write clean, maintainable code and actively engage in in-depth, honest code reviews.
  • Additionally, participation in internal technical projects and conducting technical sharing sessions will be part of your responsibilities.
Requirements:
  • Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals, encompassing algorithms, data structures, networks, and familiarity with web frontend basics such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Browsers.
  • Comprehension of development efficiency concepts.
Prefer to have:
  • Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure, with an added advantage if acquainted with Shopee’s specific implementations.
  • Experience in React, TypeScript, or expertise in certain frontend areas.
  • Background in software engineering, particularly in workflow, productivity improvements, or developer tools.
  • Previous exposure to low code, Function as a Service (FaaS), and components areas is a plus.
  • Strong understanding of user value and highly valued communication skills or leadership capability.

Come join our growing team and our mission: Helping researchers to find new treatment methods by providing them with the software they need? Our Singapore team is expanding and there is a lot to learn, discover and contribute.

  • Develop new software and contribute to existing open source software
  • Work on an analytical platform which requires sub-second responses to complex queries
  • Work on applications, which support researchers in improving the treatment of patients
  • Get in touch with the latest technologies/concepts like Kubernetes and GraphQL
  • Help to shape the product by bringing in new ideas for features and usage of technologies
  • Contribute to the automation of the set up and running the platform on Kubernetes and Azure

Who we are looking for

  • Programming skills in at least one programming language e.g. Java, Python or JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Ideally, you would have experience in developing and operating micro services on e.g. Kubernetes
  • Experienced in SQL
  • Ideally experience with cloud providers like AWS or Azure
  • Experience with Pulumi or Terraform is a plus
  • 2 years of relevant experience, however fresh Computer Science graduates will also be considered
  • You are a team player who loves to share knowledge and ideas with your colleagues
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Fluency in English

Why you will love working with us

  • Actively contribute to developing digital health solutions with a direct impact on the health and quality of life of others.
  • Nonprofit work with a purpose: With us, you will find a fulfilling and meaningful task in a nonprofit environment that will advance our society.
  • A diverse team of professionals from various countries working together from 3 locations (Potsdam, Berlin and Singapore).
  • Subsidized gym membership to encourage a healthy lifestyle.
  • A generous education budget of up to S$1500 and 2 education days per year (pro rata depending on your working hours) for courses, books, conferences, and your professional development.
  • Real Work-Life-Balance with flexible working hours and various work models.
  • Subsidized home broadband to support home and remote work locations.
  • Support for your mental health: One-on-one psychological sessions or peer group sessions with Likeminded.
  • A first-class corporate health insurance that includes dental and maternity coverage.
  • Subsidized annual check-up, to encourage regular health screening.
  • Regular knowledge transfer through “all hands”, “town halls” and “Knowledge4Life” events.
  • Several employee driven initiatives, every new colleague is welcome to participate in (for example the “Climate initiative” or “Diversity, Equality & Inclusion”).
  • An extensive and detailed on-boarding program to make your start at Data4Life as efficient and smooth as possible

About us

Data4Life is a nonprofit organization with the vision of making the world a healthier place. With a team from different countries, we work together on the mission to digitize health research. By linking technology and research, we make health data available to research in a comprehensive, digital and secure way. Our interdisciplinary team in Potsdam, Berlin and Singapore brings together experts from fields such as product development, digital engineering, data security and science. Data4Life was founded in 2017 and is funded by the Hasso Plattner Foundation.


We care about

Diversity: Many different lives, careers, and development paths lead to Data4Life. We welcome experts from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to our international team, offering everyone equal opportunities to be themselves and develop to the best of their abilities. Diversity, equality, and inclusion are not just nice words at Data4Life – we put them into practice in all of our activities and projects, striving to incorporate them in our everyday lives. For this reason, we signed the Charta der Vielfalt (Diversity Charter) in 2022.

The Climate: Data4Life is a member of the Leaders for Climate Action community and climate neutral since 2019.

column2:
Join us at Lasso

Lasso is an AI-powered agent designed to manage and resolve issues in production environments autonomously. It uses an LLM based reasoning engine to react to, interpret, and implement solutions to production issues, even those it's encountering for the first time.

Technology companies are grappling with the complexity of production environments, distracting engineers from their core task of software development. Engineers are drowning in a sea of observability data, but still require manual intervention to solve problems.

We envision a future where engineers can concentrate on software development while Lasso takes care of the production environment. Our mission is to develop autonomous software that can manage, repair, and optimize itself—the holy grail.

Now is a magical time to join. We're a small group of veterans in AI, software, and infrastructure, backed by a leading AI venture capital firm and Silicon Valley angels.


About the role

We’re hiring our first Founding Software Engineer. It’s probably our most critical hire. You will help to design and develop the core components of our product. You will significantly contribute to building our company culture, defining the experience for our earliest customers, and laying the foundation for all future team members.


Ideally, these qualities describe you

  • You’re obsessed with the customer.

  • You have strong software engineering fundamentals. You have opinions on how software is developed.

  • You’ve operated infrastructure at scale. You’ve seen it done right, and you’ve seen it gone wrong. Kubernetes, Kafka, Spark, microservices, and all the usual suspects.

  • You love building with generative AI and have had some prior ML/AI experience.

  • You have experience in Rust, C++, or Scala. Our stack is Python, TypeScript, and Go right now, but some experience in high-performance languages are important.

Examples of what you’ll do

  • The founding engineer will work closely with the CEO, CTO, and our product team to develop the core product offering and help build out the team. You’ll work on the LLM-based reasoning engine, memory module, evaluation stack, simulation environment, and a lot more.

  • Help us iterate towards product-market fit in an early stage, open ended environment.

  • Embody our end users (engineers with operational responsibilities), immersing yourself in their needs, pains, and aspirations.

How we work:

  • Less is more: Small teams deliver impactful outcomes. Our focus is on meaningful work rather than long hours.

  • Culture is critical: We value excitement and chemistry. We only bring in the right people who align with our vision.

  • Transparent compensation: We’ll give you levers to adjust your compensation. $120k-$180k base, and 0.5-1.5% equity. 401k matching. Great healthcare.

  • We’re in-person: We move faster when we work from the same room. We have offices in Singapore and San Francisco. We’re flexible, but prefer in-person.

  • An AI-first approach: We don't simply build AI products; we augment ourselves with it.

Interview process:

The whole process takes less than one day

  • Screen: A quick call with one of the founders.

  • Technical assessment: You don’t have to grind Leetcode for weeks. We just need to work through a problem together in a call to understand how you think.

  • Culture fit: We’ll talk through your background, what drives you, and share a bit more about our team and culture.

  • Food: Grab lunch or dinner with us!

iZeno was founded in 2003 to provide enterprises with custom-built technology solutions to keep their business running seamlessly. Logicalis Asia, part of the Logicalis Group, a leading international IT solutions and managed services provider, has acquired a majority stake in iZeno, a company specializing in digital transformation, application modernisation, DevOps, customer experience and hybrid cloud solutions.

With a team of 120+ in-house innovators, we have delivered over 500 Enterprise Solutions, implemented, and optimized to enable smarter insights. Our team draws on industry experiences in accomplishing a portfolio of mission-critical applications, integrating Cloud, CRM, Data Analytics, and other leading technologies with our clients' existing IT frameworks.

With a leading presence in the region, headquartered in Singapore and operations in Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand and Philippines, no project is too complex for us, and our team is always ready for a new challenge. 

The Role
  • Executing delivery of both client and internal project.
  • Follow through the entire Software Development Life Cycle.
  • Interpret systems specifications to develop, maintain and support application implementation.
  • Provide technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and implementing systems and procedures to meet user requirements.
  • Configure system settings and options and execute acceptance testing.
  • Analysis, development and implementation using JAVA and Spring Boot.
What we are looking for
  • 5 years’ experience in a relevant role.
  • Ability to interact and communicate effectively and openly with all levels of management, users and vendors.
  • Familiar with JAVA and Spring Boot Framework.
  • Willing to pick up and learn new software and technologies.
  • Strong documentation and solution design skills.
  • Analytical with good problem-solving skills.
  • Experience with integration project.
  • Familiarity with RedHat, Containers, and DevOps will be advantageous.
What we have to offer
  • An exciting job with latest technology
  • Continuous training & development of soft and hard skills
  • A competitive salary, inline with your profile
  • A package of benefits including healthcare insurance
  • Hybrid working mode with opportunity to work from home 9 days in a month
  • An awesome team of colleagues & regular team building activities
  • The ability to work with the world’s leading companies in technology and innovation
  • An environment where we embrace openness, transparency and grab every opportunity to have fun, while always doing what is right for our customers and partners.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Company Information

Desay SV is a leading high technology company focusing on providing smart mobility solutions. During the pandemic period, DESAY SV proudly demonstrated outstanding capability in developing cutting-edge in-vehicle computing units as well as robust supply chain management and intelligent manufacture. It furthers strengthened our leading position in the market, and we have been nominated to chair most of the automotive technology revolution strategies at National level in China.

In the role of Research Engineer, Mapping & Localization, you will be involved in researching, developing, and deploying algorithms for environmental mapping & accurate positioning of self-driving cars; you will be able to interact with vehicle manufacturers and access state-of-the-art autonomous vehicle testing platforms in real testing environment; you will be expected to tackle a broad range of real-world localization problems and come out with robust solution to help ensure our vehicles are safely driving on the road.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Design and implement High Definition 3D Mapping using LIDAR, Vision and/or GPS-INS systems
  • Design and implement real-time vehicle localization using LIDAR, camera and sensor fusion
  • Design and implement real-time vehicle localization via map matching
  • Calibration of multiple sensor setup on vehicle
  • Test algorithm on real-road driving
  • Write professional design and technical documentation

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience. Master’s degree and above will be an advantage.
  • 3+ year experience in C++ software development, preferred on Linux platform
  • Strong knowledge on Lidar SLAM with real deployment experience, and/or, experience with Visual Odometry(VO), Visual-inertial Odometry(VIO), Visual SLAM
  • Good knowledge on 3D Reconstruction, SLAM, scan matching, ICP and Bundle Adjustment
  • Good knowledge on probabilistic theory, Kalman filter, particle filter, estimation, nonlinear optimization techniques
  • Experience with nonlinear solvers such as Ceres, g2o
  • Good knowledge on sensor characterization (Eg. error modelling, bias, stability etc.)
  • Hands-on experience in sensor interfacing, data capture and synchronization
  • Experience in using version control tools such as Git
  • Able to work independently and also collaborate as team player
  • Strong problem solving, analytical and conceptual skills, with good communication skill

  • Health insurance
  • Work from home

  • 13th month salary
  • Performance bonus

  • Bachelor's or equivalent (Preferred)

  • Software development: 2 years (Preferred)

column2:
Our mission is to move more with less. The world is changing, people want shorter and cheaper journeys and their goods to be delivered faster. Gone are the days when manual planning suffices. SWAT is building the technology to allow fleet operators and logistic companies to compete in this new world.


The patented algorithm we developed solves an academic problem (researched since the 1980s) called the “pickup and delivery with time windows” – in layman terms: "how do you move the most number of objects (people or parcels), using the least number of vehicles, in the shortest time or distance possible". SWAT is the market share leader in pooling optimization technology in South East Asia and operates in countries like Singapore, Japan, The Philippines and Thailand. We are tackling some of the most challenging transport/logistics problems in the world’s most congested cities. Many large corporations from different industries such as shipping, logistics, airline, pharmaceutical, utilities, banking, property development and public transport use our technology to improve employee commute convenience and happiness and save costs. It’s also greener, more sustainable. Our customers are governments, public transport operators or large companies with challenging employee commute needs.


Come join our AI SaaS high growth tech startup if you also have the ambition to make a big impact in making the world move more sustainably. There is so much more we want to do and it will be a great place for you to learn and grow with the company.


Responsibilities:


  • Develop and maintain various backend systems that powers our passenger, driver and operator applications, allowing our system to optimise and automate mission critical operations for our customers.
  • Design and implement scalable systems on cloud infrastructure using modern frameworks.

Requirements:


  • BSc in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.
  • At least 2 years of backend programming experience.
  • Good knowledge of algorithms and data structures.
  • Experience with the following programming languages: Go/Python.
  • Familiar with cloud-based deployment.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate with a multidisciplinary and multicultural team of Software Engineers, Product Designers, User Researchers, Data Scientists and Data Analysts to come up with solutions to problems.

Responsibilities:
  • Analyse, design, develop and implement software applications.
  • Develop Front-end and/or back-end applications.
  • Support product implementation and maintenance.
Required Skills/Qualifications:
  • Diploma/Degree in Computer Science.
  • Strong programming skills and good problem solving skills.
  • At least 3 years of extensive experience in ONE OR MORE of these tool sets:
  • ReactJS/Redux, CRA/DVA, React-Router, MUI/Antd, or
  • PHP, MySQL, JSON and Bootstrap, or
  • Golang with ML/DA packages.
  • Working experience with these tools: Yarn/NPM, Docker, Git, SVM.
  • Knowledge of GraphQL, AWS, Alicloud, R is an advantage.
  • Proactive, able to multitask and work independently.

Hi there!

Come join our growing team and our mission: Helping researchers to find new treatment methods by providing them with the software they need.

Your future role

At Data4Life Asia, we value our interns by providing meaningful learning opportunities in digital health. You'll be working closely with our full-time employees to contribute to existing digital health software and open source software. You can also work on prototypes if you have ideas on how our digital health solutions can best serve our end users! Our interns take ownership of their work - and they pride themselves in developing solutions that help people. You'll have the opportunity to contribute your skills, specialities and ideas the same way our full-timers do.

What you need to succeed

We particularly value internship applicants who have/are:

  • Sound programming skills in at least one programming language like Java or JavaScript
    Ideally you have knowledge of an UI framework e.g. React.js
  • Get in touch with the latest technologies GraphQL, Kubernetes and in-memory databases
  • A team player who loves to share knowledge and ideas with your colleagues
  • Have strong analytical skills
  • Preference will be given to students from institutes of higher learning in Singapore e.g. universities or polytechnics
Only applicants who meet the following criteria should apply:
  • Must be able to commit full time for a minimum of 5 months (please include start date and duration of availability)
  • Currently based in Singapore and do not require a working visa
  • Option for hybrid work model but must be able to attend in-person meetings/workshops when necessary


Why you will love working with us

  • Actively contribute to developing digital health solutions with a direct impact on the health and quality of life of others
  • Nonprofit work with a purpose: With us, you will find a fulfilling and meaningful task in a nonprofit environment that will advance our society
  • A diverse team of professionals working together from 3 locations (Potsdam, Berlin and Singapore)
  • Real Work-Life-Balance with flexible working hours and hybrid work models
  • Support for your mental health: one-on-one psychological sessions or peer group sessions with Likeminded
  • Regular knowledge transfer through “all hands”, “town halls” and “Knowledge4Life” events
  • Several employee driven initiatives, every new colleague is welcome to participate in (for example the “Climate initiative” or “Diversity, Equality & Inclusion”)
  • An extensive and detailed on-boarding program to make your start at Data4Life as efficient and smooth as possible

Good to know

  • We especially welcome applicants from the LGBTQI+ community, people with a migration background, people of color, and individuals with disabilities or chronic illnesses to the team
  • If you need support or special assistance during the application or interview process due to a disability, please feel free to let us know and we are happy to accommodate you as much as possible

About us

Data4Life is a nonprofit organization with the vision of making the world a healthier place. With an international team, we work together on the mission to digitize health research. By linking technology and research, we make health data available to research in a comprehensive, digital and secure way. Our interdisciplinary team in Potsdam, Berlin and Singapore brings together experts from fields such as product development, digital engineering, data security and science. Data4Life was founded in 2017 and is funded by the Hasso Plattner Foundation.

We care about
Diversity: Many different lives, careers, and development paths lead to Data4Life. We welcome experts from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to our international team, offering everyone equal opportunities to be themselves and develop to the best of their abilities. Diversity, equality, and inclusion are not just nice words at Data4Life – we put them into practice in all of our activities and projects, striving to incorporate them in our everyday lives. For this reason, we signed the Charta der Vielfalt (Diversity Charter) in 2022.

The Climate: Data4Life is a member of the Leaders for Climate Action community and climate neutral since 2019.

Who We Are


BCG X is the tech build & design unit of BCG. Turbocharging BCG’s deep industry and functional expertise, BCG X brings together advanced tech knowledge and ambitious entrepreneurship to help organizations enable innovation at scale. With nearly 3,000 technologists, scientists, programmers, engineers, and human-centered designers located across 80+ cities, BCG X builds and designs platforms and software to address the world’s most important challenges and opportunities. Teaming across our practices, and in close collaboration with our clients, our end-to-end global team unlocks new possibilities. Together we’re creating the bold and disruptive products, services, and businesses of tomorrow.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.


What You'll Do


Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.
Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We are looking for dedicated individuals with a passion for software development, large-scale data analytics and redefining organizations into AI led innovative companies. Successful candidates possess the following:

  • Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
  • Actively involved in every part of the software development process
  • Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
  • Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
  • Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
  • Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
  • A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics

TECHNOLOGIES:
Programming Languages: Python

Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience in software engineering or related technical field.
  • Experience working with Java.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch or real-time event processing, and estimated time to launch workflows solutions.
  • Experience developing or training models using machine learning technologies (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch).
  • Ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
  • Ability to take initiative and propose solutions when faced with hard, ambiguous software engineering problems.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills with teams within and outside of the core team and across sites.

About the job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

In Google Search, we're reimagining what it means to search for information – any way and anywhere. To do that, we need to solve complex engineering challenges and expand our infrastructure, while maintaining a universally accessible and useful experience that people around the world rely on. In joining the Search team, you'll have an opportunity to make an impact on billions of people globally.

Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and deploy abuse policies and rules necessary to keep Google compliant with regulatory concerns.
  • Design manual and automated abuse verdict generation workflows and enforcement for proactive and reactive content moderation.
  • Collaborate with machine learning experts to train and deploy automated content moderation classifiers and rule engines.
  • Develop batch pipelines to process large corpus of data.
  • Contribute to the team’s engineering practices and culture around testing, design and code review, mentorship, and hiring.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
